firing from somewhere and smoke enveloped every- thing. 
At that moment, as the Horse Guards, hav- ing passed him, disappeared in the smoke, Ros- t6v hesitated whether to gallop after them or to go where he was sent. This was the brilliant charge of the Horse Guards that amazed the French themselves. Rost6v was horrified to hear later that of all that mass of huge and handsome men, of all those brilliant, rich youths, officers and cadets, who had galloped past him on their thousand-ruble horses
